fields.description:
In the development section of a Jira issue you can view commits. When you click on the commits and look at the details of bitbucket commits the count of the number of files changed is not correct. It is correct in stash.

*Example*
https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JDEV-27283
Commit 1cfb055 shows 6 files changed

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-importers-plugin/commits/1cfb0550ef025b157dad49a1947fab7f34f40696/
Bitbucket reports that actually 54 files have changed.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Grant View Development Tools permission to the followings:
#* a single user, e.g. *sysadmin*
#* a user picker or group picker custom field, which has no default value (to make sure the field is empty upon issue creation)
# As a comparison, grant Assign Issues permission to only the user picker or group picker custom field
# Connect JIRA to Stash, Github, Bitbucket, Bamboo, FeCru, Subversion, etc.
# Create a new JIRA ticket, and mention that ticket in several commit messages from the linked applications

h4. +Expected behavior+
Only *sysadmin* can view the Development Panel if no user/group has been added to the user/group picker custom field

h4. +Actual behavior+
Any user can view the Development Panel as well as the commits' detailed info:
!view_dev_no.png|thumbnail!
!view_dev.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
* From the above images, the user can only view the Development Panel and the commits' detailed info
* He doesn't see the Assign button, meaning that he doesn't have the Assign Issues permission
* He doesn't see the Development tabs like Source, Reviews, Builds, Subversion
* If the user is added to the user/group picker custom field, then he has the Assign Issues permission as well as can see the Development tabs:
* !view_dev_yes.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: All users can View Development Panel if View Development Tools permission is granted to a User/Group Picker custom field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When connecting JIRA to a Crucible Instance that does not have FishEye Enabled, JIRA shows commits of the Repository configured within Crucible. This causes problems in the development panel, as links to the commits do not work.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Successfully linking JIRA and FishEye-Crucible, ensuring you can see a Commit in a JIRA Issue
# Remove the FishEye License from FishEye Crucible. 
# When you try to access the commit from the Branch pop-up, you get a "Project does not Exist" error.

h3. Expected Results
Commits should not be shown if they can not be accessed through FishEye.

h3. Actual Results
The Development Panel shows commits for the repository configured with Crucible, even if a Crucible only app-link is made.

h3. Notes
* This is similar to DCON-342
* We should restrict what is being shown to improve usability of the product.

h3. Workaround

One  workaround which will completely hide commits from the Dev Panel, which may not be desired is as follows:
# Click the *Administration Cog* and select "Add-Ons".
# Click *Manage add-ons* on the left-hand side of the screen.
# Use the drop-down box in the Manage Add-ons filter to select *All add-ons*.
# Locate the *Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Development Integration Plugin* and Expand this Add-on
# Click the *71 of 71 modules enabled* link.
# Locate the *devstatus-commits* module and click the *Disable* button.
fields.summary: Dev Panel shows "commits" from Crucible-Only App Link.

Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 6.1 and Stash 2.8.1
# set the Base URL to using direct URL (eg: http://localhost:8080/jira and http://localhost:7990/stash) instead of the FQDN
# create the Application Link using the direct URL

(i) On a side note, different behaviour is observed for JIRA 6.1 and FeCru 3.1.4:

# create the Application Link to use direct URL instead of FQDN
# edit the Display URL to use the FQDN URL

fields.description:
As of JIRA 6.2 the Source and Reviews tab have been deprecated in favor of the Development Panel. But when using an Evaluation License with JIRA these tabs show up and can not be removed.

These tabs should be removed when using an evaluation license as these features have been deprecated.

h5. Steps to Reproduce:
# Spin up an Instance of JIRA
# Use an a production license key
# Spin up an instance of FECRU
# Link the two instances together

Use a production license key and you'll see the below:
 !Screen Shot 2015-05-15 at 4.23.34 PM.png|thumbnail!

Use an evalution license key and you'll see the following:
 !Screen Shot 2015-05-15 at 4.32.36 PM.png|thumbnail!

h5. Work Around:
Switching back to a production license does make the source and reviews tab go away.
fields.summary: Source and Reviews Tab Appear when using an Evaluation License

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If the JIRA issue summary contains non-ASCII characters -- Japanese, Korean or even umlaut, then on creating a Stash branch from the development panel, the Stash UI will remove the non-ASCII characters from the proposed branch name.

h4.Environment
||JIRA | 6.2.7 |
||Stash | 3.1.1 |
||Browsers |Chrome, Firefox

h4.How to reproduce
* JIRA is integrated with Stash using Application Links
* Create a JIRA issue with the summary in Japanese, Korean or having non-ASCII characters like umlaut
* From JIRA Development Panel, click on 'Create branch'
* In the Stash create branch screen, the suggested branch name will not contain any of the non-ASCII characters.

h4.Diagnosis
* The Stash URL contains the proper JIRA summary including all characters, but Stash is not able to process the characters (similar to [STASH-396|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-396]). This is still being raised as a JIRA bug, because the error is observed from JIRA.

h4.Workaround
* In the Stash Create Branch screen, copy-paste the JIRA summary as required and then the branch will be created correctly.
fields.summary: Unable to create Stash branch names containing Japanese, Korean or non-ASCII characters from development panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient}} doesn't respect environment configuration settings  {{-Dhttps.protocols=TLSv1 -Djdk.tls.client.protocols=TLSv1}} and doesn't fallback to *TLSv1* mode. It still tries to connect to Host with Java default (with *TLSv1.2* protocol). If remote host supports  *TLSv1* only, so this leads to  {{javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Received fatal alert: protocol_version}} error and as a result JIRA is not resolving Stash/other capabilities properly.

h3. Environment
* JIRA with Application links
* Network environment with proxy or SSL offloading. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA with Java8
# Configure Stash with SSL configuration TLSv1 only (for example)
# Configure Applink from JIRA to Stash (for example)
# Check _Create branch_ in JIRA Development panel - it will be absent
# Navigate to *<Project>* > *Administration* > *Development tools*. Clicking 'Refresh' should send the capabilities request again.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will respect environment configuration settings and connect to remote host.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA doesn't respect environment configuration settings and fail to connect to remote host.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, WRITE: TLSv1.2 Handshake, length = 197
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, READ: SSLv3 Alert, length = 2
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, RECV TLSv1.2 ALERT:  fatal, protocol_version
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, called closeSocket()
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, handling exception: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Received fatal alert: protocol_version
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, setSoTimeout(1) called
NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1, handling exception: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
{noformat}

{noformat}
2015-11-25 11:12:28,833 NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient:thread-1 DEBUG anonymous     [menu.client.capabilities.RestCapabilitiesClient] Stacktrace: 
javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Received fatal alert: protocol_version
	at sun.security.ssl.Alerts.getSSLException(Alerts.java:208)
	at sun.security.ssl.Alerts.getSSLException(Alerts.java:154)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.recvAlert(SSLSocketImpl.java:2023)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:1125)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1375)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1403)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1387)
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.createLayeredSocket(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:290)
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.connectSocket(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:259)
	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.HttpClientConnectionOperator.connect(HttpClientConnectionOperator.java:125)
	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.connect(PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.java:319)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.establishRoute(MainClientExec.java:363)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.execute(MainClientExec.java:219)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.ProtocolExec.execute(ProtocolExec.java:195)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RetryExec.execute(RetryExec.java:86)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:108)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:184)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
JIRA 6.4.12 running on Java8 (TLSv1.2 is default for this version: see [diagnosing_tls_ssl_and_https|https://blogs.oracle.com/java-platform-group/entry/diagnosing_tls_ssl_and_https]) with configuration tuning:
{code}
-Dhttps.protocols=TLSv1 -Djdk.tls.client.protocols=TLSv1
{code}

h5. Cause
Caused by: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ANL-41

h3.Workaround
We have new version of {{atlassian-nav-links-plugin}} *3.3.22* (bundled version is 3.3.21). 
# Download [atlassian-nav-links-plugin-3.3.22.jar|https://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/plugins/atlassian-nav-links-plugin/3.3.22/atlassian-nav-links-plugin-3.3.22.jar]
# Upload {{atlassian-nav-links-plugin-3.3.22.jar}} to <JIRA_HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins/
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: NavLink RestCapabilitiesClient ignoring system properties

fields.description:
Choosing "Create branch" for an issue does not always show the right project in Stash.

Having multiple projects, the last one you visited in Stash seems to be these when coming from JIRA via "create branch". Last visited repo in stash is not equal to the project I came from in JIRA.

Steps to reproduce:
# Have multiple projects in JIRA and Stash
# Browse a repo for PROJECT TWO in Stash, click around, view merged pull request etc
# Open PROJECT ONE in JIRA, click create branch on an issue you are going to start working on
# You get redirected to Stash. Everything seems to look fine, but hang on; PROJECT TWO is automagically selected instead of PROJECT ONE where you came from in JIRA, and expected to create a ticket for.

How bad is this problem?
Very bad. This results in many branches being created in the wrong project by accident.

JIRA: v6.4.12#64027-sha1:e3691cc
Stash: v3.11.6
fields.summary: Create branch on an issue result in wrong project in Stash

Steps to reproduce (not 100% reproducible, but it CAN happen randomly):
# Install JIRA and Stash. 
# Establish applinks using OAuth and disable user impersonation.

*Expected behavior:*
# Applinks established successfully.

*Actual behavior:*
# Approving tokens in JIRA fails, e.g. the token was never generated. 
# Approving tokens in Stash fails as well. 

*Solution*

# Make sure that if "impersonation" is enabled in the outgoing authentication on one side of the link, the other side has it enabled in its incoming authentication
# If affected by [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1151], then simply delete and recreate the link. You may need to delete the link separately on each side before recreating it.

fields.description:
h4. Tested with
* Jira 6.3.1
** 2 connectors open (8080, 8081)
** Base URL set to {{http://localhost:8080/jira}}
* Stash 3.2
** 2 connectors open (7990, 7991)
** Base URL set to {{http://localhost:7990/stash}}

h4. Steps to reproduce
h5. Applink Setup
# Set up application link from Jira to Stash using {{http://localhost:7991/stash}}. Jira queries Stash's base URL {{http://localhost:7990/stash}} as _Display URL_. 
** *DO NOT* check _I am admin on both instance_ to prevent automatic applink creation (automatic applink creation would use the base url of JIRA for both application URL and Display URL. 
# Set up application link from Stash to Jira using {{http://localhost:8081/jira}}. Jira queries Stash's base URL {{http://localhost:8080/jira}} as _Display URL_.
** *DO NOT* check _I am admin on both instance_ to prevent automatic applink creation (automatic applink creation would use the base url of STASH for both application URL and Display URL. 
# Configure the application link to use 2 legged oauth autentication *WITHOUT* impersonation.

h5. Developement Panel testing
# Create a repo in Stash and push some commits with Jira issue keys in it
# View the issue in Jira.The commits will be listed in the Development Panel
## Click on the commits to see more details.
## Jira will prompt you to authenticate from Stash. Click Authenticate.
## Click allow in the prompted Stash screen.

h4. Expected Behavior
The commit details popup in Jira should refresh and the commits would appear

h4. Actual Behavior

h3. Steps to reproduce:

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

If you start JIRA while Stash or Fisheye is offline but configured in an app link, then after it starts, the development panel will not display, but the source tab will display. Additionally if you go to the "Development Tools" section of a project administration, then you will find that all the capabilities show an error.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Start JIRA and Stash/Fisheye
# Create an applink between them
# Ensure there is some commit in Stash/Fisheye with a JIRA issue key that exists in JIRA
# Stop both
# Start in turn, JIRA first. JIRA must have fully started before you tell Stash/Fisheye to start.
# Go to the issue in JIRA that has a commit linked to it
# Observe the Source tab is there but not development panel

h4. Workaround

One of the following:

# Wait up to an hour for the applications to sync their capabilities up correctly
# Hit the refresh button on the development tab in JIRA's project admin screen, which will fix it immediately.
fields.summary: Development Panel not displaying, but Source is displayed, if JIRA is started while Stash or FishEye is offline

fields.description:
h5. Problem
If JIRA/Stash with SSL connections are using an invalid hostname in the SSL certificate, workflow triggers will not work. Other functions of the application link integration appears to be working as expected.

h5. Summary
- Configure JIRA and Stash with SSL in Tomcat(using SSL certificate with an invalid hostname)
-- [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]
-- [Securing Stash with Tomcat using SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Securing+Stash+with+Tomcat+using+SSL]

Sample *Connector* from _server.xml_ file used for both JIRA and Stash with the only difference being listening ports:
{code}
	<Connector port="8443" protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"
              maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" SSLEnabled="true"
              maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
              enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
              acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
              clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
              keyAlias="jira639" keystoreFile="<jira-home>jira.jks" keystorePass="changeit" keystoreType="JKS"/>
{code}

(i) Tests via Applinks Diagnostics plugin all come back successful.

- Go to workflow in JIRA and when adding a workflow trigger you'll see a message telling you 'JIRA is not able to communicate with Stash':
!trigger.png|thumbnail!

(i) It is possible to still add the trigger, however tests reveal that it does not work as message in the diagnostic above indicates.

h5. Verifiy
- Please see [Development Panel missing and Workflow triggers not working|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Development+Panel+missing+and+Workflow+triggers+not+working] to confirm whether you are using a valid SSL certificate.
fields.summary: Workflow Triggers not working with Tomcat over SSL when certificate contains invalid hostname

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When creating an application link between JIRA and Bitbucket Server ( formerly known as Stash ) , if the Display URL and Application URL used it different. 
 !image-2015-11-16-20-59-27-913.png|thumbnail! 
* This workaround only works temporarily , once the JIRA and Bitbucket Server is restarted, it will fail again :
{quote}
1. First  change the base url in JIRA to the one used in the application url

2. Then create the application link from Bitbucket using the same Display URL and Application URL . You will first need to ensure that the application url and the base url is the same during the creation of the application link. 

3. Then after the creation is successful and you are able to confirm that the coomits show on the development panel & workflow trigger works, edit the base url in JIRA back to the desired URL and also edit the application link's Display URL in Stash to the desired URL 
{quote}

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7
* Bitbucket Server 4.1.0 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Install JIRA and Bitbucket Server
2. Integrating JIRA with Apache as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/integrating-jira-with-apache-185729645.html
3. JIRA is now accessible with 2 urls :
*  (unproxied URL)
*  ( proxy url )

4. Set the base URL of JIRA using the proxy URL
5.  Configure application link from Bitbucket Server using the (unproxied URL)
6.  Create a new issue in JIRA ( issue key TT-25 )
7.  Create repo , branch and commit the msg
{code}
git checkout -b 'bugfix/TT-25'
touch 25
git add 25
git commit -m 'TT-25'
git push origin bugfix/TT-25
{code}
8. The information on the development panel shows and workflow triggers work fine ( Merge Pull Request )
9. Restart JIRA & Bitbucket Server

h3. Expected Results
# Development panel displays relevant data.
# Issues are transitioned by workflow triggers when the triggering actions are executed on BBS.


h3. Actual Results
1. New commits, branches, etc do not show in the development panel and the workflow triggers no longer work .
2. The application link does not work anymore as the when adding a new commit does not show any information on the development panel and configured workflow triggers (e.g. Merge Pull Request ) do not work.
fields.summary: Application link between JIRA and Bitbucket Server breaks when using different Display URL and Application URL

*Symptom*

Dev Panel sometimes fails to be rendered when the user having access to Dev Panel accesses to the issue detail page. Dev Panel is sometimes successfully rendered when the user refreshes the page.

*How I reproduced*

# Prepare vanilla CentOS 6.5 64bit
# Install Git
# Install JIRA 6.3.6 and Stash 3.6.1 using 64bit installer
# Configure Application Link between them
# Create a project and a issue in JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-14884].
  {panel}

Accessing the ConfigureDevStatus page on the Summit demo instance: http://summitdemo.dyn.syd.atlassian.com:2430/jira/secure/ConfigureDevStatus.jspa?projectKey=TIS gives an error page with the following exception:
{code}
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Templates.DevStatus.Admin.projectAdminPage: In 'print' tag, expression "$projectKey" evaluates to undefined.
                             at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMainHelper(BaseTofu.java:341)
                             at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMain(BaseTofu.java:300)
                             at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.access$100(BaseTofu.java:56)
                             at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu$RendererImpl.render(BaseTofu.java:427)
                             at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyManager.render(DefaultSoyManager.java:111)
                             at com.atlassian.soy.impl.SoyTemplateRendererImpl.render(SoyTemplateRendererImpl.java:40)
                             at com.atlassian.soy.impl.SoyTemplateRendererImpl.render(SoyTemplateRendererImpl.java:33)
                             at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraSoyViewDispatcher.dispatch(JiraSoyViewDispatcher.java:36)
                             at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchViaSoyView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:148)
                             at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:65)
                             at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:204)
                             at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:722)
{code}
Following some troubleshooting, it was found that the root cause is the following exception:
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class com.atlassian.jira.webwork.JiraSafeActionParameterSetter can not access a member of class com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.we
b.admin.AbstractProjectAdminAction with modifiers "public"
        at com.atlassian.jira.webwork.JiraSafeActionParameterSetter.setActionProperty(JiraSafeActionParameterSetter.java:227)
        at com.atlassian.jira.webwork.JiraSafeActionParameterSetter.setSafeParameters(JiraSafeActionParameterSetter.java:129)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory$SafeParameterSettingActionFactoryProxy.setActionParameters(JiraActionFactory.java:275)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory$SafeParameterSettingActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(JiraActionFactory.java:162)
        at webwork.action.factory.ChainingActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ChainingActionFactoryProxy.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory.getActionImpl(JiraActionFactory.java:353)  <+2> (GenericDispatcher.java:141) (JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:152)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:722)

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class com.atlassian.jira.webwork.JiraSafeActionParameterSetter can not access a member of class com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.web.admin.AbstractProjectAdminAction with modifiers "public"
        at sun.reflect.Reflection.ensureMemberAccess(Reflection.java:95)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:607)
        at com.atlassian.jira.webwork.JiraSafeActionParameterSetter.setActionProperty(JiraSafeActionParameterSetter.java:208)
        ... 174 more
{code}

It appears that JiraActionFactory was trying to call the setter method for projectKey but failed due to IllegalAccessException. In theory, in order to use reflection to invoke a public method, Java requires the class itself to be accessible by the caller. (https://vaadin.com/forum#!/thread/1414726/1416458)

In our case, AbstractProjectAdminAction, which is the class that owns the setProjectKey method, has default/package access. :|

Changing the class to public fixed the problem on the summitdemo instance. *But we need to figure out why it worked (and still works) on all other instances, including jdog and the jira-fusion OD instances.*
fields.summary: Dev status admin page shows error with projectKey undefined in soy template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-14878].
  {panel}

When linking JIRA and Bamboo (2-Legged OAuth), if Bamboo's Display URL is different from its own Application URL, then it's not possible to view Bamboo Builds in JIRA's Development Panel. The following message can be seen from the log:
{code}
2014-08-15 23:18:34,906 http-bio-2788-exec-22 WARN admin 1398x67x1 f6o9gj 192.168.8.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/detail [plugin.devstatus.provider.DefaultCoordinator] Requests failed: Andy's Bamboo 5.5.1 (java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request url 'http://andynguyen.vn/bamboo/rest/jira-dev/latest/detail/build?globalId=TEST-1' doesn't match rpc url 'http://localhost:6551/bamboo')
{code}

This is closely related to JRA-37781, however, JIRA 6.3.3 doesn't fix this problem with Bamboo.

The following screenshots are typical of this problem:
# from Project Administration -> Development tools:
!warning.png|thumbnail!
# from View Issue screen, sometimes no Build is visible in the Development Panel but the Builds tab is visible:
!error1.png|thumbnail!
# sometimes Build is visible in the Development Panel but clicking on it will show this message:
!error2.png|thumbnail!
# from Add-ons -> Application Links, it's clear that Bamboo's Display URL and Application URL are different
!applinks.png|thumbnail!

If Bamboo's Display URL and Application URL are the same, then everything works fine. This is usually a problem for those users who would like to bypass proxy in creating AppLinks i.e. using localhost for Application URL but FQDN for Display URL (and Base URL).
fields.summary: Cannot View Bamboo Builds in Development Panel if Display URL is Different from Application URL

fields.description:
h5. Problem
If JIRA/Stash with SSL connections are using an invalid hostname in the SSL certificate the Development Panel will not appear as expected.

(i) Please see [Development Panel missing and Workflow triggers not working|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Development+Panel+missing+and+Workflow+triggers+not+working] to confirm that you are using a valid SSL certificate.

h5. Summary
- Configure JIRA and Stash with SSL in Tomcat
-- [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]
-- [Securing Stash with Tomcat using SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Securing+Stash+with+Tomcat+using+SSL]
- Using JIRA 6.3.9 and Stash 3.5.0

Sample *Connector* from _server.xml_ file used for both JIRA and Stash with the only difference being listening ports:
{code}
	<Connector port="8443" protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"
              maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" SSLEnabled="true"
              maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
              enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
              acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
              clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
              keyAlias="jira639" keystoreFile="<jira-home>jira.jks" keystorePass="changeit" keystoreType="JKS"/>
{code}

(i) Tests via Applinks Diagnostics plugin all come back successful.

- Development Panel does not appear on the _View Issue_ page as expected.
-- Source tab appears
-- Permissions checked to ensure user has rights to *View Development Tools*
-- *Development Integration Plugin* is enabled
-- Using OAuth for authentication(tested with both 2LO and 2LOi)
fields.summary: Development Panel not appearing when Stash and JIRA is connected over SSL configured in Tomcat if certificate contains invalid hostname

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA and Stash are configured behind a reverse-proxy serving SSL on separate subdomains of the same domain, the following occurs:

* The JIRA Development Panel does not appear
* JIRA to Stash Triggers report as not being capable
* The JIRA Capabilities Warning appears in the Project Administration screen

h3. Environment

* Apache reverse-proxy is configured with the following VirtualHosts:
{code}
<VirtualHost *:443>
	ServerName jira.example.com
	DocumentRoot "/usr/local/var/www/htdocs"
	<Proxy *>
		Order deny,allow
		Allow from all
	</Proxy>

	SSLEngine on

	SSLCertificateFile "/usr/local/etc/apache2/2.2/server.crt"
	SSLCertificateKeyFile "/usr/local/etc/apache2/2.2/server.key"

	ProxyRequests           Off
	ProxyPreserveHost       On

	ProxyPass               /	http://example:8080/
	ProxyPassReverse        /	http://example:8080/
</VirtualHost>

<VirtualHost *:443>
	ServerName stash.example.com
	DocumentRoot "/usr/local/var/www/htdocs"
	<Proxy *>
		Order deny,allow
		Allow from all
	</Proxy>

	SSLEngine on

	SSLCertificateFile "/usr/local/etc/apache2/2.2/server.crt"
	SSLCertificateKeyFile "/usr/local/etc/apache2/2.2/server.key"

	ProxyRequests           Off
	ProxyPreserveHost       On

	ProxyPass               /	http://example:7990/
	ProxyPassReverse        /	http://example:7990/
</VirtualHost>
{code}
* JIRA's {{server.xml}}:
{code:XML}
        <Connector acceptCount="100" connectionTimeout="20000" disableUploadTimeout="true" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1" redirectPort="8443" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" 
            scheme="https" proxyName="jira.example.com" proxyPort="443" secure="true"/> 
{code}
* Stash's {{server.xml}}:
{code:xml}
        <Connector port="7990" protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"
                   useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                   redirectPort="8443"
                   compression="on"
                compressableMimeType="text/html,text/xml,text/plain,text/css,application/json,application/javascript,application/x-javascript"
		   proxyName="stash.example.com"
		   proxyPort="443"
		   scheme="https" />
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure JIRA and Stash behind a reverse-proxy over SSL on separate subdomains. It can be easy to do this by setting {{/etc/hosts}} to {{127.0.0.1}} and using the above Apache config.
# Access the Project Admin screen and click on Development Tools.
# Attempt to view the development panel of an issue with a linked commit.
# Attempt to add a workflow trigger.

h3. Expected Results

# The capabilities warning does not fail.
# The development panel appears for the issue.
# The workflow trigger capability check responds correctly.

h3. Actual Results

All of those 3 actions fail with the attached errors.

h3. Workaround

Either of the following will workaround the problem:

* Running JIRA & Stash over HTTP.
* Running JIRA & Stash over HTTPS on the same domain, using context paths. For example:
** https://example.com/stash
** https://example.com/jira
* Setup multiple IPs for the server and use IP addresses in Apache VirtualHost's, for example:
{code}
NameVirtualHost *:443

<VirtualHost 192.168.1.110:443>
   ServerName jira.example.com
</VirtualHost>
<VirtualHost 192.168.1.111:443>
   ServerName stash.example.com
</VirtualHost>
{code}

h3. Notes

This may be related to SNI in JIRA & Stash as per the attached issues.
fields.summary: Stash integration functionality does not work properly when JIRA and Stash are behind SSL on subdomains

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Install the subversion plugin (version 1.0)
# Create a connection to an SVN repository
# Do a commit with the JIRA issue key on the commit message
# Access the Subversion tab on the ticket mentioned in the commit message

h3. Current behaviour

No information will be displayed on the tab.

h3. Expected behaviour

Show the commit on the subversion tab as expected.

h3. Workaround

Disable and then reenable the "Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Development Integration Plugin" in the "Manage Add-Ons" section in JIRA's Administration. Please notice this is a system plugin and so you will need to choose this option on the plugins list.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we move an issue from backlog to an empty sprint, the RANK is not updated. 
_Steps to reproduce:_
# Create a new board with 2 sprints
# Create at least 3 issues to backlog
# Move _Issue 1_ to Sprint 2
# Move _Issue 2_ to Sprint 1
# Move _Issue 3_ to Sprint 2 after _Issue 1_
# On *Search for issues* page, you will notice the order of the issues is
#* Issue 1 -> Issue 3 -> Issue 2
!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!
!Screenshot2.jpeg|thumbnail!

This is not sensible where the higher ranked sprint has a lower ranked issues.

h3. Note
Noticed that this behaviour is caused by the act of moving an issue into an empty sprint is not changing the rank. When there's an issue in the sprint, the rank will then changed accordingly so the issues in the same sprint would have a similar rank.
See !RANK.webm!

h3. Suggested Resolution
RANK should adjust according to the sprint even the sprint is empty.
fields.summary: Higher Ranked Sprint Should Have Higher Ranked Issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Intermittently, an agile Kanban project with Backlog enabled doesn't display the "Backlog" section icon in the sidebar menu or the "Kanban board" option. Scrum boards don't show the "Backlog" and "Active Sprints" icons in the sidebar menu.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software

h3. Cause

The memory cache of the board doesn't contain a project ID, although the filter does, so the board is considered to be without a project and so it doesn't display the options. This cache is rebuilt every 30 minutes so the problem fades away.
For this reason, the problem doesn't affect all board but it does affect all users accessing the board.

*The reason for the cache being incorrect is still unknown.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

While the problem is happening
 # Go to a board with the problem.

*Somehow board cannot get the project ID* so Backlog is missing.
h3. Expected Results

The left bar would show "Backlog" section icon.
h3. Actual Results

"Backlog" section icon is missing.
h3. Workaround

Background Reindex JIRA
The problem may still happen again in the future and another reindex will be needed to refresh the memory cache.

Alternatively navigate to the board using the Board menu. Backlog can be accessed by adding {{&view=planning}} to the board URL.
fields.summary: Backlog option is not showing in the Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When opening issues in issue detail view on either Kanban or Scrum boards, request is sent to {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=undefined}} which receives a 400 Bad Request response because of the invalid issueId {{issueId=undefined}}.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software 7.2 environment without any dev-tools integration* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a freshly installed JIRA Software 7.2 instance, create an Agile Board (Kanban or Scrum doesn't matter)
# Populate the Agile project with a few issues
# Enable the development tools network tab of your browser
# From the Agile board, select any issue so that it loads in the issue detail view panel to the right.
# Observe than when you select an issue there is a request to {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=}}

h3. Expected Results
These rest calls actual have the correct issue ID appended and return a 200 response e.g. {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=10000}} 

h3. Actual Results
The rest calls are missing a valid issue id and appear like {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=undefined}}. Note {{issueId=undefined}}

h3. Notes
Interestingly the problem corrects itself, if you have these instance integrated with Develpment tools (e.g. Bitbucket, Github etc.) to activate the dev panel. Once you delete the Development tools integration the problem re-surfaces.
fields.summary: 400 Bad Request in response to /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=undefined when using issue detail view on Agile board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for the issues in a particular Sprint (eg Sprint 1) using the Sprint name in the JQL (eg Sprint = "Sprint 1"), it will display other issues in other sprints that start with 1 (Sprint 10, Sprint 11, Sprint 12 etc)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few Sprints up to 10 or more, so that the Sprint name will be 10 or more.
# Go to the Issue Navigator.
# Search using the JQL (replace project name and sprint name accordingly with your own.) {code}project = "project name" AND Sprint = "sprint name 1"{code}

h3. Expected Results
The Issue navigator will ONLY return issues that are in "sprint name 1".

h3. Actual Results
The Issue navigator will also return issues that are in "sprint name 10", "sprint name 11", "sprint name 12" and so on.

h3.Workaround
Search for the issues using the Sprint ID instead of the Sprint Name for more accurate results. 

You can refer to [JIRA Software: How to search for a Sprint using JQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Software%3A+How+to+search+for+a+Sprint+using+JQL] on how to retrieve the Sprint ID.
fields.summary: Searching for Sprint names with numbers through JQL returns other issues that start with the same number

fields.description:
If there is a board (Scrum or Kanban) where some users have permissions to all projects while some others do not have permissions to at least one of the projects, then the board will not appear in the Project left panel.

 

The boards are still available while navigating from the top menu >> Boards.

This behaviour is not intuitive for the end user.
h3. How to Replicate
 # Login as user that has permissions on all boards and navigate to one of the projects from the top bar Projects dropdown.
 # On the left panel, notice that the board is showing up under "Boards in this project"
 # Now, login as another user that does not have access to at least one of the projects in the board filter and navigate to the same project.
 # Notice that the board is not showing up in the "Boards in this project"
 # Both users can see the board if they use the "Boards" menu from the top bar.

 
h3. Workaround

Provide this user access to the project or remove the project from the board filter.
fields.summary: Creating a board with projects that not all users have access to, will make it disappear from the Projects page left menu

fields.description:
We have a browser session open with a tab for each Sprint member, this is saved as a browser session. When reopened the assignee defaults to the last assignee selected, in this case one is left with a bunch of open tabs for the same assignee. If one uses a tab reloader when each tab is activated then the assignee just keeps bouncing to the last selected on a tab. 

So, currently the url includes, e.g.
type=TB&selectedProjectId=10345&selectedBoardId=10469&start=0n

Can the web service be updates to include an assignee reference in the URL to avoids this happening?

fields.description:
Hi,

I have alreasy asked this question [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/41455836/have-a-date-filter-to-configure-release-notes]

Since I got any activity I suppose it's better to ask the same here.

The [Apache OFBiz® project|http://ofbiz.apache.org/] ([JIRA uses its Entity Engine underneath|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/configuring-the-entity-engine-for-jira-720411822.html]) [publishes a monthly blog post|https://blogs.apache.org/ofbiz/entry/apache_ofbiz_news_august_2016]. For that we manually format our Subversion trunk commits log for the concerned month. Would it not be possible to have a date filter in our trunk "[Configure release notes|https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ConfigureReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=12310500&version=12311928]"?

Of course I don't mean a specific feature for the OFBiz project nor even the ASF JIRA instance, but a feature available for everybody in the next JIRA release

Thanks!
fields.summary: Have a date filter to configure release notes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user views an issue on the board, the user can still able to see the _Add Comment_ function even though the user does not have the _Add Comment_ permission.
h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.319.1
JIRA Agile v1000.38.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as any user who has the permission to view Scrum board
 # Revoke the _Add Comment_ permission from this user
 # Go to the Scrum board
 # Select any issue and it will be displayed at the right section
 # Click on _Add Comment_ and add a text
 # Click on _Add_ to add the comment
 # Error below will be displayed:
 ** 
{noformat}
Communications Breakdown
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser 
{noformat}

 ** From Developer Console: !Selection_098.png!

h3. Actual Results

The user can see the _Add Comment_ button
h3. Expected Results

The user should not be able to see the _Add Comment_ function at the first place

Notes: The error message is somehow misleading and should be improved with an informational message.
fields.summary: The Add Comment function still visible from the board even though the logged in user does not have the Add Comment permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira 7, it is not possible to display release statistics as available in the previous version (Jira 6) as below: 
 !jira6.png|thumbnail! 
In Jira 7 , only overall statistics as below is available and user will not able to filter the statistics according to its release version.
 !jira7.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to select release version so that user can view statistics equivalent to pre-release instead of overall statistics
fields.summary: Display release statistics in the Jira 7 as available in the previous version (Jira 6)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At my company we've recently begun using the Scrum agile methodology, and we've found that JIRA is not suited to tracking work by iteration / sprint. While versions can be used as iterations, this is confusing because iterations are an orthogonal concept. A particular problem we have with using versions for this purpose is that versions are specific to a single project (as they should be). However, our teams often work on multiple projects, and we track work across all these projects. Another difference is we usually determine the end date of a version by the estimates for assigned issues, while for iterations it is the opposite - we determine the end date first and then determine which issues it can contain.

JIRA should allow iterations to be defined with a name, start date, and end date. Additionally, an iteration is not tied to one project, but may be assigned to any number of projects. Perhaps some sort of "iteration schedule" could be created, with projects assigned to an iteration schedule receiving all the iterations on that schedule. Alternatively, if sub-projects were supported (as per JRA-12241) an iteration created in a parent project could be inherited by the children.

Any relevant reports should be included, such as burndown charts. In addition to tracking by time, it would also be nice to track by story points.

Other functionality might be helpful. For example, at the end of a sprint I want to push any unfinished items to the next sprint. Items in progress need to be split, perhaps with separate subtasks automatically created?
fields.summary: Iterations

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment, it is not possible to set a condition to transition Epic only when the Stories linked to it are in a certain state (e.g: Done). 

Suggested Solution
It would be great if there is a workflow function that could transition Epic only when all linked Stories are in certain states as per the current post-function for parent and sub-tasks (Transition parent issue).
fields.summary: Provide the ability to set condition to transition Epic only when Stories are in certain state

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-14833].
  {panel}

JIRA Software creates several custom fields, and these fields are locked.

System administrator should be able to translate it even if custom fields are locked.
These custom fields are locked to maintain canonical name as consistency.
Since translation of CF does not harm these consistency, locked fields need to be translatable.

h4. WORKAROUND
[How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]
fields.summary: Should be able to translate locked custom fields of JIRA Software

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are using JIRA+Greenhopper, have about 30 projects and we need to create monthly milestones and weekly sprints. creating this many new versions is cumbersome and we are looking for a way to script this. Jelly scripts can create versions, but cannot set the parent/child relationship or the start and end date. This information can only be entered in Greenhopper planning board -not in the JIRA 'project/manage versions' screen.
fields.summary: Add hierarchical functionality to the addVersion API

fields.description:
Our team uses Kanban methodolgy while operating. So, we don't have any plan mode on our boards.
When all the work concerning 1 initiative comes to the end, I transit my epic to Closed status with Post-function on it "Update Epic Status = Done". My final status also has the property "Jira.issue.editable = false" set on it.
Next time, when I go to my Epic, I will not be able to add Issues in epic (because my epic is now not editable). However, when I create new issue and start filling "Epic Link" field, i still can see my epic in dropdown list. Moreover, I can pick particular Epic, create issue within it and no system message/ error appears. Finally, when I look at my Closed Epic, I can see it's Issues in Epic field updated with the information about recently added issue.

As far as i'm concerned, the only way to eliminate my epic from Epic Link field's dropdown list is to mark it as done on my Scrum board. However, the way we work doesn't suppose running Scrum boards.
So, my question is:
How can I eliminate my closed Epic (with its cf"Epic Status" = Done) from Epic Link field's dropdown list?
fields.summary: As a project administrator I would like to restrict creating new issues in closed Epic

fields.description:
As originally discussed on the related issue JSW-11177.

Per row metrics (assignee) similar to
 * Issues
 * Issues Missing Estimate
 * Original Time Estimate
 * Remaining Time Estimate
 * Time Spent (tracked at JSW-14771)



"Missing Estimate" is only a count of issues that are missing estimates.
"Remaining Estimate" is not an accurate reflection of remaining work or when exactly we should expect to be completed if everything goes according to the plan (estimate), if there are incomplete issues with remaining estimate = 0
 * So any ticket that has not been estimated would fall into that category,
 * Plus any ticket that is not in Resolved or Done state, and although it might have had an estimate at some point, but the current remaining estimate = 0

Having an idea of how many such tickets are in the sprint (current or the one being planned) gives us a better assessment of the situation.
fields.summary: Ability to see 'Issues Missing Estimate' in 'Workload by Assignee' summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are instances where removing workflows that were added via the Marketplace or third party add-ons cause the 'Status Category' for workflow status' to show up as empty and grey in color. This subsequently causes issues in this workflow status' to not appear within a JIRA Software / Agile board.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA Agile v1000.38.1
Server - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a workflow from the Atlassian Marketplace
# Assign this workflow to a project
# Ensure you have JIRA issues on a Software / Agile board in different status'
# Remove the workflow from your instance
# Check the Software / Agile board

h3. Expected Results
All issues should still be displayed in their respective columns

h3. Actual Results
Issues that are in specific status' created / added by the downloaded workflow will be displayed in grey and will have no actual category selected. These issues will not be displayed on the Software / Agile board

h3.Workaround
Users can edit their workflow status' and select a category. Once this is done, refreshing the Software / Agile board will display the missing issues again
fields.summary: Issues do not show up in JIRA Software / Agile board when a workflow status category is not set / grey button

h3. Summary

While it is possible to add custom fields of many other types to the Issue Detail View in configuring a Board, custom fields of the "Project Picker" type, do not appear to be among them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom field of type "Project Picker (single project)"
 # Associate it properly such that you would expect to be able to choose it, per instructions in [Configuring the issue detail view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWAREserver071/Configuring+the+issue+detail+view]{quote}
Note that fields will only appear on an issue if they have been associated with the relevant issue type, and are not "hidden". For details, please see the following pages (JIRA Admin documentation):
 * for built-in fields: [field configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Specifying+field+behavior]
 * for custom fields: [custom field context|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Configuring+a+custom+field]{quote}
 # Attempt to add the new project picker custom field to the Board's Issue Detail View

h3. Expected Results

See the new custom field available as an option to be added.
h3. Actual Results

Custom fields of the Project Picker type are not shown in dropdown lists of available fields.
h3. Notes

Custom fields using types from add-ons sometimes are available to show here, and sometimes aren't.
fields.summary: Unable to add Custom Fields of "Project Picker" Type to Board Issue Detail View

h3. Summary

If you select the button Add flag and comment (board view), it will open a new screen to add a comment, if you select add nothing will happen and you won't be able to cancel the operation, the screen will freeze.
 It happens only when the issue on that board is associated to a Service Desk Project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board that contains issues from a JIRA Service Desk project.
 # Click either Backlog, Active sprints, or Kanban board.
 # Select an issue from a JSD project within the board
 # Click the issue then in question and in the Issue Detail View, select "Add flag and comment".
 # Write the comment and try to add it.

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be flagged and a comment added to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

The screen freezes in JIRA Cloud instances.
 In JIRA Server an error is thrown on the screen of
{code:java}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'trim' of undefined  
{code}
!typeerror1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Add the flag and the comment separately (not applicable for Cloud).
fields.summary: Add flag and comment is not working on Service Desk projects

fields.description:
The default Road Map view in JIRA 4.0 shows each upcoming build. On the right side of the page for each build is a graph showing the progress for that build.  Below the graph the page shows "X of Y issues have been resolved" where "X" and "Y" are the counts and are links to generate filters that show the issues represented by the counts.

If I click on the "X" link I get a URL that looks like this:

http://myserver:port/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10090&fixfor=11020&jqlQuery=resolution+in+%281%2C+2%2C+3%2C+4%2C+5%2C+6%29

The filter this generates seems to ignore both the "fixfor" parameter and the "pid" parameter.  I get a filter that shows all the issues across all projects with the resolutions in that list.  Here is the summary of the filter from the left side of the page:

Summary
Resolutions: Completed, Rejected: Not Necessary, Rejected: Duplicate, Rejected: Incomplete Requirements, Rejected: Cannot Reproduce, Deferred 
Sorted by: Key descending 

If I remove the jqlQuery parameter from the URL and resubmit, the pid and fixfor parameters then take effect.  Seems as though the jqlQuery parameter results in those other two getting ignored.  

Thanks for looking at this -- and thanks for a great product.
fields.summary: Links from Road Map generate incorrect filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The rapid view really got my attention because I saw that grid and thought "aha, I bet the rows and columns can be defined by any arbitrary JQL statements"... then I looked at the documentation and it appears that the columns must map to status values.

But it is close to a generic grid control for viewing JIRA issues.

I have a use case for such a generic grid control.  Our group uses JIRA for tracking a variety of government decision-making tasks.  Things like the decision process for deciding whether a species should be listed as threatened or endangered.  These kind of processes have a lot of steps.  It hasn't seemed very useful to create workflows for the detailed steps of these processes... but, it is possible to use JQL queries to sift out the processes that are in similar stages, for example, those processes that are under legal review.  We would find it really useful to have a grid view of JIRA issues that we could configure with arbitrary JQL statements.  

Of course we would want to be able to define multiple such views, with differing grid definitions.  And we would want to be able to display these grids via dashboard gadgets.

Thanks for considering our request!
fields.summary: Generic grid views with rows and columns defined by JQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
In the development panel, the committer avatar is shown as the default avatar regardless of the user avatar at Bitbucket Server side.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
* Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket Server.
* Create a repo and make a commit with its commit message including an issue key on JIRA side.
* Let Bitbucket Server capture the commit.
* Create a user that uses the same email address as the committer, then specify a unique avatar.
* Navigate to the mentioned issue key in JIRA.
* Click the "Commits" link in the Development Panel.

h3. Expected Result:
- As how bitbucket have mapped the committer account to Bitbucket Server account, the Avatar will be shown.

h3. Actual Result:
- JIRA will still show the default Anonymous avatar beside the commits.

h3. Notes:
- Tested in JIRA 7.1.0 and Bitbucket Server 4.1.0
- Tested with FerCru 4.0.3 and the avatar is shown when the committer is mapped with FerCru user.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server Committer Avatar is using the default avatar
